title: Neil Woodford replaced by Schroders on his Patient Capital trust – but should investors stick or twist?
text:
What happens when one of the most respected investors in Britain loses you thousands of pounds taking high-risk bets on poorly performing stocks?

Neil Woodford investors have the answer to that question after Schroder Investment Management was appointed to take over the discredited stock picker’s Patient Capital investment trust.

Following the Woodford meltdown, Schroders will run the investment company with the same strategy, but will rename it the Schroder UK Public Private Trust, to reflect the mix of listed and unlisted shares in the portfolio.

The firm is on a mission to rescue the fund, after investors lost 70pc under Mr Woodford’s management. But does management change guarantee recovery,...
